page.title: 01BELCHAMP ST. PAUL AREA
page.content: { }This area has always been extremely rural.{Agriculture}is the main industry but being entirely arable and machine orientated actually employs very few people. The countryside is beautiful and unspoilt still though trees and hedges are disappearing.The centre of Belchamp St.Paul has been made a{conservation area}which means that development is restricted. Houses are comparatively expensive so young people tend to move away. The average age of residents is rising. The school is declining. There is a post office store, mobile fish and vegetable van, daily deliveries of post, milk, bread and newspapers. Buses run to Sudbury on Tuesdays,Thursdays and Saturdays. There is a church, community house, three public houses,a garage,a playing field, sewerage works, mains water, electricity,telephone, policeman.
